intro: Petrophile dasyclada, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. This species is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pink or red flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Petrophile dasyclada is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands.
